attributes.action: Legislate to prevent the regulatory bodies from seeming to fine the customers, for the shortcomings of large organisations, but instead impose sanctions against the individuals responsible for the failings.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We have recently seen the regulators issuing heavy fines against bodies such as Nationwide Building Society for security failures (loss of laptop), Southern Water for systematically dishonestly reporting its performance data, leading to unjustified price increases, and now Network Rail for incompetence in organising engineering work over the Christmas period (announced the same day chairman Sir Ian  McAllister is knighted for "services to transport"). It would be a better joke if it were not for the fact that similar fines have been imposed after fatal rail accidents for which the organisation was found culpable.
The only people effectively punished when the organisation is fined as a body, are the customers and taxpayers, and the guilty get off relatively unscathed.
